sentence.Network_en: He tried to calm them, but was greeted with shouts of derision.
sentence.Network_cn: 他试图让他们平静下来，但却招致他们大声的嘲笑。

sentence.Network_en: Her speech was greeted with howls of derision.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的演讲受到阵阵嘲笑。

sentence.Network_en: Americans speak with derision of those who are lazy.
sentence.Network_cn: 美国人总是带着嘲笑的口气谈论那些懒惰的人.

生活大爆炸学习笔记(上) ... balderdash： 胡言乱语；废话 derision： 嘲笑, 嘲弄 come into existence ： 开始存在; 形成; 成立.
英语单词常见词根总结|英语资料大全 ... ridicule 嘲笑 derision 笑柄，嘲笑 rupture 破裂，裂开.
deputy 副的derision 愚弄derive 获得;起源

list.abs: derisive laughter , booing , etc., 嘲弄的笑声 , 嘘声等.
an object of scorn or derision ., 藐视或嘲笑的对象.
it was an acute one for certain American writers cherished democracy but whose work lay exposed to popular derision .对于某些热爱民主而作品广受公众嘲笑的美国作家，的确是一个严重问题。
People gives out derisive sound ., 人们都发出嘲笑声.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from late Latin derisio(n-), from deridere 'scoff at'

entry.def: If you treat someone or something with derision, you express contempt for them.

example.ex: He tried to calm them, but was greeted with shouts of derision.
example.tran: 他试图让他们平静下来，但却招致他们大声的嘲笑。

means.word_mean: 2. the act of deriding or treating with contempt

auth_sentence.content: I felt this shower as a kind of derision.
auth_sentence.res_content: I felt this shower as a kind of derision.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I felt this shower as a kind of derision.

auth_sentence.content: Every attempt I made to write was greeted with derision.

auth_sentence.content: To Hitchens's left, there is enmity and derision.

sentences.en: Americans speak with derision of those who are lazy.
sentences.cn: 美国人总是带着嘲笑的口气谈论那些懒惰的人。

sentences.en: He gave a snort of derision.
sentences.cn: 他哼了一下鼻子表示嘲笑。
